programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les misses Ashley's presence in the shop, while a man employs menacing tactics to persuade the dealers to buy a couple of outdated computer monitors.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: The signature round allows the chefs to serve up big flavours, big personality and some big mistakes.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: The team prepares a borehole for divers, after scanning sonar confirms a longheld belief that one of its chambers may contain a chest, as well as human remains.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Faced with storms, currents and deadly gators, the hunters risk life and limb to fill their tags. Revisit the scariest moments of the series in this special episode.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie Davis battles a truck fire on The Coq, then reveals big changes, while Jordie welcomes his brother back to the family business as they tackle a vehicle in a river.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Jimi Hendrix's former photographer visits the shop with a selection of unpublished pictures, and the team values two dune buggies and a 1930s denim jacket.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick values a device for predicting the outcome of horse races, and is shocked when a customer brings in a secret service ID and some counterfeit money.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Pointless co-host Alexander Armstrong takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Roisin Conaty and broadcaster James O'Brien joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former deputy prime minister John Prescott, actress Rebecca Front and comedian Micky Flanagan join host Frank Skinner, making the case for their pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include goal celebrations, school ties, celebrity chefs, audience participation and other people's music.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Panellists Julia Zemiro, Matt Lucas and David Mitchell and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy quiz show. In this edition, the presenter meditates on matters medieval and macabre, and as usual, he poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: Beth is contacted by a shy girl who used her image on a dating site, and now wants Beth to meet her new beau.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle become action sport film directors as they realise their dream of creating a Zombie vs Parkour chase scene.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie's competitive spirit is fired up when a broke Llewellyn challenges him to a pub quiz with a £5,000 jackpot - but sadly, Bryan, Jed and Marlene's general knowledge leaves a lot to be desired. Tyler tries to make amends after Beth accuses him of being anti-Welsh. Comedy, starring John Challis.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The world's most impressive disused railway bridges, including the biggest wooden trestle bridge in the world, which was closed down due to hurricane damage.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The case of Dr Crippen, who murdered his wife and buried her in the basement before fleeing to Canada.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Walmer castle, Kent, and is challenged to identify a valuable 18th-century glass out of a collection of reproductions. Other items brought in to be valued include a rare pottery piglet, a revolving table with secret compartments, a British PoW's diary, a set of French fashion illustrations from the 1920s, a table clock and a collection of Victorian ceramic birds.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A vast project in the icy wilderness of southern Alaska, and a landscape of confusing and surprising structures that represented a bold statement of Spain's plans for the future.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two programmes from Walmer Castle in Kent, where the team values a jacket worn by President Kennedy that could be one of the most valuable items ever featured on the series. Other items brought in include an art deco mask that terrifies its owner's children, an enamel advertising sign, and a letter from Lord Nelson that has an unexpected connection to the owner's dead husband.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The world's most impressive disused railway bridges, including the biggest wooden trestle bridge in the world, which was closed down due to hurricane damage.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: Documentary exploring racial tensions in 1940s California, when suspicion of young Mexican men resulted in a series of brutal attacks by military personnel on civilians.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ghostly house in a tropical paradise that is still feared by the locals and a pioneering complex marked by both glory and tragedy that will soon to be lost forever.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: Divers search a newly discovered wreck as they investigate the story of the SS Justicia, sunk in the First World War by U-Boats off the coast of Ireland.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Beth and Tyler announce they have become vegetarians and set off to Ludlow races to protest about the treatment of animals. Meanwhile, Jed's scarecrow in the barn is mistaken for a human body, and Marlene enrols on a mail-order reiki healing course as part of a plan to create a massage parlour and beauty salon at the farm.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Tyler is left cold by all the kerfuffle as the family awaits the arrival of his French exchange student. He even considers getting engaged to Beth in a bid to get out of paying a return visit to France. However, the guest's eventual arrival causes a stir all round. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie's competitive spirit is fired up when a broke Llewellyn challenges him to a pub quiz with a £5,000 jackpot - but sadly, Bryan, Jed and Marlene's general knowledge leaves a lot to be desired. Tyler tries to make amends after Beth accuses him of being anti-Welsh. Comedy, starring John Challis.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: Documentary exploring racial tensions in 1940s California, when suspicion of young Mexican men resulted in a series of brutal attacks by military personnel on civilians.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A police cadet's body is found, and it soon transpires that his demise mirrors the death of another murder victim killed months previously. When Sam Ryan and her forensic team investigate, they discover the dead man's training college could prove vital in solving the crime. Acclaimed drama series, starring Amanda Burton, with a guest appearance by Tim Healy.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by Tim Healy

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jo Masters goes undercover as a warder at Stonewall prison to investigate the source of drugs which have led to a spate of overdoses. Yvonne Hemmingway comes across an old flame involved in a shooting case and is forced to arrest him for concealing vital evidence, while Dan Casper's affair with commander's wife Rochelle Barratt is strained when they clash over a professional matter. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: On an exchange trip to Holland, Nick is reunited with Marianne. Meanwhile, Blue Watch are called to a blaze at a fire station.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: B Company are on exercise in the Northern Territory of Australia, and their skills are put to the test during a trip in the outback.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A worrying event back home involving his wife forces Michael Stubbs contemplate his priorities. Starring Robson Green and Rob Spendlove.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jo Masters goes undercover as a warder at Stonewall prison to investigate the source of drugs which have led to a spate of overdoses. Yvonne Hemmingway comes across an old flame involved in a shooting case and is forced to arrest him for concealing vital evidence, while Dan Casper's affair with commander's wife Rochelle Barratt is strained when they clash over a professional matter. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Abra and Ric are determined to keep the truth hidden when their kidney transplant patient returns to Holby. Jac impresses Lord Byrne but alienates Joseph in the process, until she realises she needs to keep him on her side and makes an enticing offer. Meanwhile, Matt continues to get close to psychiatry patient Nikki, but begins to worry about the implications of their relationship.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Patrick and Holly find themselves stranded together in a barn in the depths of the countryside during a heavy snowfall, and sparks fly back at the hospital as news of Duffy's pregnancy begins to spread around the department, leaving her shocked at being given a rare cold shoulder by Charlie. Drama, starring Derek Thompson and Cathy Shipton, with a guest appearance by Windsor Davies.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by Windsor Davies

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Reg Hollis and Tony Stamp observe drugs being brought into Stonewall women's prison through the visitors' hall as corrupt officers turn a blind eye. Jo Masters realises Cath Wilson has used her to establish herself as top dog on the wing and sets out to get revenge. Yvonne Hemmingway is sorely tempted when her ex Nick pleads for a second chance. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark comes up against Ian's greed when he puts a business proposal to him. Bianca & Natalie get revenge on Richard. Steve gets his come-uppance when an old score is settled.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard finds himself at the centre of an escalating nuisance campaign. Cindy decides to give a surprise birthday party for Ian.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Gregg's romance with Tiggy develops, and Blue Watch are called out to deal with a massive blaze at a used-car lot. Starring Steven Houghton.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Will desperately tries to make up with the ambitious Sarah and comes up with a plan to clear their debts, but his actions have dire consequences. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Danny Flint finds his bachelor lifestyle cut short by his sister's death, leaving him in charge of nine-year-old niece Cady. Meanwhile, Beth's efforts to balance motherhood and a nursing career pose a dilemma, and Anna and David finally tie the knot. Guest starring Elizabeth Spriggs, with Kerrie Taylor, Lesley Dunlop and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: An encounter with an old flame makes Sharon feel broody, while Tracey has her work cut out pampering Garth in the school holidays. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: To celebrate her 40th wedding anniversary, Marlene wants to renew her marriage vows with Boycie, and tries to make contact with old friends while compiling the guest list - only to receive devastating news. Comedy, starring John Challis and Sue Holderness.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo and Clegg hatch a devious plan to free henpecked Wally and Howard from their wives - if only for a few hours. Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: After Clegg is visited by three teenage missionaries, Seymour believes it is about time he offered his considerable talents and services to the local vicar, so sets about selling tickets for its staging of The Tales of Beatrix Potter. Peter Sallis and Michael Aldridge star.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The inspector and his ambitious sergeant John Bacchus investigate the murder of Dolores Kenny, a black woman. She is a regular attender of a local club's soul all-nighters, events popular with factory workers from across the racial divide. Gently begins to uncover evidence of prejudice within the local community and his own police force as he seeks to identify the victim's killer. Detective drama set in 1968, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Lenora Crichlow, Craig Conway, Pippa Bennett-Warner and Maggie O'Neill.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman with dementia runs away from her care home and turns up at a south London police station to report a murder - sparking a reinvestigation into the mysterious disappearance of her police officer husband in 1956. The official report says that he fell into the river after one too many beers - but what secrets was this seemingly straight-as-a die old-fashioned bobby keeping? Meanwhile, Steve's son is arrested for buying weed, bringing the retired cop face to face with his ex-wife - a woman he hasn't seen in 10 years. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star, with a guest appearance from Julie Graham.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: When a government minister is killed by a fire in a London hotel, terrorists are suspected of starting the blaze _ until Leo discovers a wad of notes on the MP's bed. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan tries to uncover the truth, but finds her investigations are hampered by a former schoolfriend who claims to work for the Cabinet Office. Amanda Burton and William Gaminara star.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Phil Vickery is this week's guest judge on the cookery competition, with nine more contestants battling it out today for the £1,000 cash prize. The first challenge is designed to test the participants' knife skills, then six go on to joint and debone a chicken before the final three concoct a dish using the bird's meat as the main ingredient . Fern Britton hosts.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: The Gandhi family answer top 10 questions on subjects including EastEnders, The Jungle Book and Formula One, as they try to score the 'Perfect 10'. Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Sam, Chris, Andre and Vince pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jamie is left panicked when Andrea and Millie disappear, while Nate approaches Rhona with a proposition, suggesting they split half the restaurant order with Butlers. Brenda seeks an apology from Amelia for egging her window, but when Amelia maintains her innocence, Kerry tells Brenda to clear off.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Alya makes a shocking discovery regarding Geoff, Asha's problems follow her to her new school and Roy invites Shona to move into his flat.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: In the sixth and final episode, the brothers prepare to say their goodbyes to Mumbai, but before they leave, they are invited to appear on a local news report. For their final stop in the city, the boys meet 85-year-old Norma Otter, who was a team-mate of Dougie's international hockey star aunt, Pansy Thomas. Following the meeting, the boys decide to take on a junior girl's hockey team who are training nearby. As their adventure draws to a close, the family arrive in Jejuri in the midst of the 100,000 festival goers who are there to take part in what is known as the Golden Festival.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a nine-month-old terrier who was found wandering the streets whilst heavily pregnant, before spending time with a three-month-old puppy called Pancake, who is having problems with his eyesight. Elsewhere, a dog arrives at Battersea who was found dumped with a terrible case of mange and an injured leg.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: Happy 60th Birthday
programme.desc: In honour of his 60th birthday, this special programme celebrates the illustrious career of Bradley Walsh, from stand-up comedy and presenting, to quiz shows and acting. As well as forgotten gems from the telly archives, his 1980s fashion choices and hairstyles, viewers will also get to relive those moments of TV gold that have turned him into one of the country's most adored stars. Presented by Jason Manford.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which five players answer questions about top 10 lists. Subjects include rugby union, Grease and boys' names beginning with J. Then they try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mechanic Edd China finishes working on the Land Rover Discovery and, after a successful road test, Mike Brewer has a buyer lined up.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk experts Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit Dan, a born-and-raised New Englander whose collection might turn out to be off-limits.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team aims to finish the bike for Rick Petko. Design company Nub Grafix gives it an old-school feel, while Paul Teutul Sr collects the sissy bar.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: How Italy has struggled to establish itself as having a military aviation force to be reckoned with.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe pays tribute to the dirtiest American Presidents, revealing the secrets of their pets.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The design, creation and manufacturing process behind the Audi S8, the Volkswagen Group's 1996 update on their classic luxury four-door sedan, the Audi V8.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew visits the birthplace of the Ultima Evolution and explores its exterior.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do planes take off and land on a beach at one of the world's oldest airports? And, how do they hand-make the national dress of Bavaria, lederhosen?.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: In Cornwall, Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove visit a trials car enthusiast with an eclectic set of sheds. Will they come away with a jeep, a bike or something else?.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: In Cornwall, Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove visit the Queen's armourer, Terry English, and find an amazing collection of vintage British cars, bikes and engines.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Winter arrives in Dutch Harbor and the fleet prepares to hunt opilio crab, but before any lines are thrown a deckhand quits and two brothers fight, with one going overboard.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justin tackles a deal that could make or break him. The Boulder Boys race to save their claim from a monsoon flood, while the Cooke Brothers finally make a valuable discovery.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Hampshire, an old leisure centre is torn to the ground. Then, in Lincolnshire a team scour military settings for old weaponry that can be turned into cash.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China work on an old Aston Martin DB7, hoping to restore it to its former glory but hidden problems threaten to blow their budget.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is asked to sell six cars including a 1952 Jaguar XK 120 Roadster and a 1969 Oldsmobile 442 Coupe at the Gooding auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Restorer Wayne Carini hopes his '55 Ford Thunderbird will attract high bids at the Gooding auction.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: A profile of the F-Type Jaguar, which has been designed as a pure sports car, and engineered for high performance and responsive road handling.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justin tackles a deal that could make or break him. The Boulder Boys race to save their claim from a monsoon flood, while the Cooke Brothers finally make a valuable discovery.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Unrelenting winds rip across the crab grounds, and the crew of the Wizard prepares to do battle with the descending polar ice pack. Meanwhile, tempers flare on board the Kodiak.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk experts Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are picking and dreaming in California when Mike falls for the sweetest classic Ford pick-up he has ever seen.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and his long-time friend Tee John set out on a tour of France. In Normandy, Drew falls in love with a grand chateau and in a massive antique fair immerses himself in pop culture.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: Gary is in Bingley, West Yorkshire, to tear down an old police station without destroying the entire building. And, a man turns scrap metal into sculptures..

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer finds a Land Rover Discovery for £1,500 and hands it over to mechanic Edd China for restoration work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mechanic Edd China finishes working on the Land Rover Discovery and, after a successful road test, Mike Brewer has a buyer lined up.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: It's the end of the mining season and the last chance for the teams. The Rookies gamble their hopes on one last haul of opal and the Opal Queen makes a final desperate dig.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard haggles over a collection of medical antiques, visits a warehouse full of vintage Americana in Nottinghamshire, and takes a trip to a Scottish stately home.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Blacksmith conservator Matthew Boultwood takes on a piece of British military history - a ceremonial helmet from one of the oldest regiments in the army, the Life Guards. Jay Blades and the team also restore a miniature chest full of hidden treasure and an extremely rare Victorian clockwork rabbit.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how sardines are fished and processed. Plus, the manufacture of ejector seats and Piaggio scooters.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of clogs and pasties, plus how planes are painted.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer searches for a BMW M3 E36 that Edd China can restore to make a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China goes over budget to restore a BMW M3 E36, making it more difficult for Mike Brewer to achieve a profit when he sells it on.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The use of forensic technology in the search for some of America's 1.8 million missing persons, from runaways who find their way home to those who vanish for ever without trace.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Carl Starke, shot dead close to his home in Florida. Police turned to CCTV to help hunt his killer, resulting in a huge manhunt and shocking on-camera interview.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of 24-year-old Crystal Houston in the desert town of Socorro, New Mexico. She died in April 2001, 14 months after her older sister, Stephanie, was killed in a suspicious accident.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How two fugitives committed the biggest bank robbery in Wisconsin's history after escaping on their way to court.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A litter of puppies faces a struggle for survival, and a malnourished horse has trouble giving birth.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown gets a terrible delivery when a kitten with shocking injuries turns up in a cardboard box, and Tim Faulkner struggles to remove a diamond python from a drain.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Selfish sisters are running wild in the salon, causing dress-shopping chaos for the brides. Lori and her team race to control the sibling rivalry.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lori wonders if she needs to break out her sage to please superstitious brides.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Marie wants to please her mother and brother, but her indecision mixes with their strong opinions, while Jamie leaves her dress decision to the toss of a coin.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three collectors visit a market in Cogolin, St Tropez, with 800 euros to spend, as they hunt for items to sell in just one day for profit at an auction in Shrewsbury.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: The arrival of a life-sized suit of armour and matching horse amuses staff at the new Hatton Garden shop, while MD James takes a trip down a canal on a barge that a businessman is looking to secure a loan against. A sunseeker hopes to sell some precious family jewellery to help fund a move to Spain, and Lawrence is faced with a mysterious wooden chest thought to have belonged to the royal family.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: An emaciated dog is brought in to the centre weighing only a third of a healthy bodyweight, and the team quickly discovers its owner also needs their urgent help.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: An undercover investigation leads the team to the shocking discovery of eight dogs tied to metal chains, dog-fighting paraphernalia, illegal drugs and a gun.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How the analysis of insects found on dead bodies can be used to calculate time of death, and even offer clues to the victim's identity.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic sculptors can create a face in the likeness of a victim, often leading to the naming of unidentified corpses.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 22-year-old Bradyn Fuksa, who vanished in July 2009 after taking a mysterious 10-hour journey from Kansas to Wyoming before abandoning his vehicle.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Tanya Rider, who disappeared in September 2007 on her way home from work in Maple Valley, Washington. Barely alive, she was discovered eight days later at the bottom of a steep ravine inside her wrecked car.

programme.title: True Crime with Aphrodite Jones
programme.desc: The case of Rosemarie Essa, whose apparent heart attack in Cleveland, Ohio, was not the true cause of her death in 2005. It transpired she had been poisoned by a cyanide-laced calcium pill dispensed by her husband, a doctor. An international manhunt crossing three continents ended in Cyprus 18 months later with the arrest of Yazeed Essa.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kandice travels from Texas to find a striking dress for her vow renewal, while Barbara wants a sexy gown with sparkle to match her stilettos.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Violet wants a tight-fitting gown to wear at her Dominican Republic wedding, fussy Rachel hopes Kleinfeld's will be her last stop and Leighann has high standards.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Requests Like None of the Rest
programme.desc: Amanda searches for something with sparkles and glitter, Charae wants a 1980s dress and Lynsey opts for a short party look.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nightclub worker Emily wants a sexy look for her big day, but her mother has more conservative ideas and tries to persuade her to tone it down a little.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Dana takes her two bridesmen to her appointment, while Akisha brings along her fiance's best man, hoping a male perspective will help her reach a decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Mackenzie knows exactly what she wants - a dress that makes her look like Jessica Rabbit, so consultant Britney tries to find the perfect item.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: A woman seeks the truth of her adoption to dispel the fear she was a secret, while a couple worry about their son after contact with his adoptive family stops.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Melissa deals with an unplanned pregnancy, and Ashley seeks new inspiration when her weight loss grinds to a halt.

programme.title: My Extreme Excess Skin
programme.desc: Two women whose weight gain was caused by illness and family issues, and who now find their life being made a misery by excess skin.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: An eight-year-old girl from Mexico, who was born with Moebius Syndrome which paralysed her face, undergoes delicate microsurgery.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How the disappearance of a young woman in a small community led to a massive media campaign and nationwide hunt for a sadistic serial killer.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The difficulties faced by forensic scientists and police in catching bombers and snipers, who often have no connection to their victims.
